qas.question: How do they manage the landscape?
What technique do they use to make animal habitats?
What is the manipulation of the landscape associated with?
What do modern hunter-gatherers depend on at least somewhat?

plausible_answers.text: the landscape through cutting or burning undesirable plants while encouraging desirable ones

qas.question: None of the modern hunter-gatherers depend of which kind of food sources?
Which group uses a slash-and-burn technique to create habitats for humans?
Which group burns desirable plants while encouraging undesirable ones?
Very few hunter-gatherers encourage domestication on what level?

context: Many <b7_0><b8_0>hunter-gatherers<b8_0/><b7_0/> consciously manipulate <a0_0><b5_0>the landscape<a0_0/> through <a1_0>cutting or burning undesirable plants<a1_0/> while encouraging desirable ones<b5_0/>, some even going to the extent of <a2_0>slash-and-burn<a2_0/> to create habitat for game animals. These activities are on an entirely different scale to those associated with <a3_0>agriculture<a3_0/>, but they are nevertheless domestication on <b9_0>some<b9_0/> level. Today, almost all hunter-gatherers depend to some extent upon <a4_0><b6_0>domesticated<b6_0/> food<a4_0/> sources either produced part-time or traded for products acquired in the wild.
